meanings.definition: A structure dividing a space into separate areas.
meanings.sent1: The wooden partition separated the living room from the dining area.
meanings.sent2: The office had a glass partition to create privacy for each employee.
meanings.sent3: The colorful partition in the classroom made the students smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a partition, breaking the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The partition in the maze led to the hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: The act of dividing or separating something into parts.
meanings.sent1: The partition of the cake into slices was done carefully.
meanings.sent2: The partition of tasks among team members helped them work efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The partition of chores between siblings caused a playful argument.
meanings.sent4: His decision to leave was a partition that changed the dynamics of the group.
meanings.sent5: The partition of colors in the painting created a beautiful contrast.

meanings.definition: A section or part of something that is separated from the rest.
meanings.sent1: The partition of the garden for vegetables and flowers was well-planned.
meanings.sent2: Each partition of the hard drive stored different types of files.
meanings.sent3: The partition of the book into chapters made it easier to read.
meanings.sent4: The partition of the team into smaller groups improved communication.
meanings.sent5: The partition of the city by the river created distinct neighborhoods.
